channel.title: Landing Pages on Foldie Links
channel.description: Recent content in Landing Pages on Foldie Links

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description:
Privacy Policy

The app Foldie Links is a tool and data collection is kept to a minimum.

What You can do

  • Within the app the user has access to folders that he or she explicitly provided access to.
  • Additionally the user can create data in the form of links, notes, metadata and settings.
  • Some of the user-created data is synced accross the user’s devices using iCloud to support similar workflows accross devices.

Your data is not collected

  • No user data is collected.
  • No data about the usage of the apps is collected.
  • No file contents from the user’s file system is collected.
  • No data is sent to servers other than to the private iCloud database.

Data collection by others

  • Within the app, no data is collected by 3rd parties.
  • Crash reports may be collected by Apple if approved by the user.
  • When leaving the app by following links to the web, navigation data may be collected on the web by 3rd parties.

item.title: Privacy Policy of the Web Site
item.description:
This is the privacy policy of this web site. For the privacy policy of the Foldie Links app, see here.

Privacy Policy

This web site provides information about the Foldie Links app. We, the authors, do not collect any information about you, the visitors. We try hard to keep this 3rd party traffic at a minimum, but we cannot avoid it completely.

Data collection by others

Some basic information, such as your IP address, is processed by our hosting provider (GitHub Pages). We also use common web resources, such as JavaScript and Font packages, that are hosted on 3rd party servers. Beyond that, we are not aware of using other data-collecting services.

item.title: Support
item.description:
If you have a question, please check the FAQ and other information on this website for an answer first.

If English is not your first language, consider using your browser’s translation function. In Safari, you’ll find this button:

  • On Mac: in the browser’s address bar.
  • On iPhone and iPad: in the browser’s address bar, in the left-hand menu.

If you are still having trouble, please send an email to Foldie ‘at’ webli ‘dot’ de.
